500.description: Core brand color, itâ€™s what will be seen mostly onsite.

200.description: This is the core value for any neutral elements.

Success.description: This is the most common success green, it is to be used for positive or successful interactions onsite.

warning.description: Yellow is used for alert, caution, warning to parts of the site.

error.description: Red is meant for destructive interactions onsite, be careful.

primary.description: Mainly used for headers and primary copy.

secondary.description: Secondary based text, used for smaller paragraphs and captions.

disabled.description: Any text that supports disabled states.

inactive.description: Any text that supports empty textfields and inactive states.

interactive.description: Can be used for buttons, hovers or any clickable content.

inverted.description: Mainly used for copy that is on a dark themed background to keep everything accessible.

sm.description: To be used for smaller buttons, smaller widgets and elements

md.description: To be used for buttons, widgets and elements

lg.description: To be used for buttons, larger widgets and elements

primary.description: Main button usage on dark and light backgrounds.

dark.description: secondary button usage on light backgrounds.

light.description: secondary button usage for dark backgrounds
